title: What Is Quantum Computing, Is It Real, and How Does It Change Things?
author: Katie Rees
excerpt: How will quantum computing change our relationship with computers?
summary: In our modern day, standard computers are undoubtedly advanced compared to what we could muster up a few decades ago. However, with how fast and diverse computers are now, it's hard to imagine anything that could be even better. Enter quantum computing. This field of science aims to use the laws of the universe to achieve incredible goals. So, what exactly is quantum computing, and how will it affect our world in the future? What Is Quantum Computing? Image Credit: IBM Research/Flickr Though the dynamics of quantum computing are still being studied today, it originally emerged in the 1980s by physicist Paul Benioff.

title: Quantum computers: The good, the bad and the ugly
author: Adinortey Lawerteh
excerpt: What are quantum computers? How do they work? And why are they such a big deal? Let's take a look at it.
summary: What are quantum computers? How do they work? And why are they such a big deal? Let's take a look at it.So what are quantum computers?Quantum computers are computers that use quantum bits, or qubits. They are different in many ways from classical computers, which use bits that are either 1 or 0. Qubits can be in multiple states simultaneously, which means they can do several calculations at once.This is why quantum computers are such a big deal. They have the potential to be much faster and more powerful than classical computers.

title: MathWorks gives $2 million to UNM to create endowed chair for Department of Computer Science
author: Kim Delker
excerpt: MathWorks gives $2 million to UNM to create endowed chair for Department of Computer Science October 18, 2022 - By Kim Delker MathWorks today (Oct. 18) announced it has donated $2 million to create an…
summary: MathWorks announced recently it has donated $2 million to create an endowed chair in the Department of Computer Science at The University of New Mexico. The gift will establish the Cleve Moler and MathWorks Chair of Mathematical and Engineering Software Endowed Fund, which will generate funds to hire a faculty member in computer science. The UNM Board of Regents today voted to approve the named chair, which is one of only a handful in the School of Engineering. Lydia Tapia, professor and chair of the Department of Computer Science, said that the endowed chair would significantly impact the department.

title: Quantum Machine Learning: What You Need to Know
author: Coursera
excerpt: Quantum computing promises a quantum leap in processing power that could have big potential for machine learning. Explore this fascinating – and potentially game-changing – technology inside.
summary:
Quantum machine learning uses the power of quantum computing to speed up and enhance the machine learning done on the 'classical' computers we use every day. Quantum computers are designed using the often counter-intuitive laws of quantum physics and can store and process exponentially more information than the tablets, smartphones, and supercomputers that power much of the modern world. 
But quantum computers have a long way to go before being used in our everyday lives. According to McKinsey and Company, only about 2,000 to 5,000 quantum computers will likely be operational by 2030, and those capable of handling the most complex problems may not even exist until 2035 or later [1].

title: A Collaborative Detection Method of Wireless Mobile Network Intrusion Based on Cloud Computing
author: Wang
excerpt: In order to improve the communication security of wireless mobile network, a collaborative intrusion detection method based on cloud computing is studied. The mobile terminal and the cloud computing…
summary: Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing/2022/Article/Research Article | Open AccessVolume 2022 | Article ID 1499736 | https://doi.org/10.1155/2022/1499736Academic Editor: Omprakash KaiwartyaIn order to improve the communication security of wireless mobile network, a collaborative intrusion detection method based on cloud computing is studied. The mobile terminal and the cloud computing platform are connected by the wireless mobile network. The cloud computing platform authentication server adopts a dual server and multifactor authentication scheme for mobile cloud computing to provide authentication services for mobile terminal users.
